snippet.title: Celebrities Who Spoke Up Against Amber Heard’s Lies
snippet.description:
Celebrities Who Spoke Up Against Amber Heard’s Lies

Amber Heard Tries Avoiding Jail After Having A Child

Celebrities Who SPOKE UP About Amber Heard's Lies
https://youtu.be/O1Rrb3ET21c

The legal battle between Johnny Depp and Amber Heard is still proceeding and no one knows when and how it will end. Even though Johnny's defamation lawsuit is set to proceed to a trial next year, there are still so many lies, rumors and opinions about the entire situation. In the process of all this fight, many fans and even stars have expressed their opinion and they all as one claim that Amber lied and made false accusations against Johnny Depp all this time. While the case was still ongoing, even Johnny Depp’s exes testified in the actor’s defense. Vanessa Paradis and Winona Ryder have made it clear that Johnny is not a ‘wife beater’. But not only his exes stood up for Johnny. Penelope Cruz, Sharon Osbourne, Laurie Holden and others shared their opinions on the entire situation. 

10. Penelope Cruz

Let’s start this list with Johnny Depp’s co-star Penelope Cruz, who worked with Johnny in three movies: Blow, Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides, Murder on the Orient Express. Penelope Cruz was the one who officially defended Johnny Depp by providing a written testimony. According to the documents, Penelope said, “Many years have passed and I have not only made 3 movies with him, but I also count on him as a great friend. I’ve always been impressed by his kindness, his brilliant mind, his talent, and his peculiar sense of humor.” The actress even went into detail about how Johnny Depp treated her during her pregnancy with her first child. “During six months of my first pregnancy,” Penelope Cruz wrote, “I spent every single day with him while we shot Pirates of the Caribbean. My husband and I will never forget the sweetness, protection, and kindness he treated me with during every single step of that process.” So, judging by these words, it is clear that Penelope doesn’t believe Amber’s accusations.

9. Laurie Holden

Laurie, Walking Dead star, didn’t officially defended Johnny in court, as Penelope, but she took to Twitter and defended him, because she had an “impassioned reaction to the vilification of a human being on social media and the public outcry for complete and utter rumination.”

“I, for one, am going to see Johnny Depp’s new movie,” the actress referred to Alice Through the Looking Glass. “His personal life is just that. Personal. No one knows the real truth so just zip it.” “To be clear: I am just saying DON’T JUMP TO CONCLUSIONS,” she added. “Even a pic might not be telling the whole story….” Well, she didn’t say a word about Amber but it is clear that Laurine is on Johnny Depp’s side.

8. Paul Bettany 

Another Johnny’s co-star is Paul Bettany, who worked with him in three films – Transcendence, The Tourist and Mortdecai. He also took to Twitter to express his opinion about the entire situation, “Known Johnny Depp for years and through several relationships”. “He’s the sweetest, kindest, gentlest man that I’ve ever known. Just saying.” “All I’m saying-Domestic violence is a serious allegation,” he continued. “Trial by Twitter is unhelpful. Let the facts come out before rushing to judgment.” Well, Amber, it seems like more and more people DO believe Johnny Depp.

7. J.K. Rowling

Another big name that expressed her opinion was JK Rowling. After Warner Bros. shared a cast photo in November that re-confirmed Johnny Depp was reprising his role as dark wizard Gellert Grindelwald in the series’ second film, The Crimes of Grindelwald, some people took to social media to criticize the decision. She was the one who defended Johnny Depp and always wanted him to stay in this role. JK Rowling has shared a blog post on her website in which she defended the decision to not recast the role. “I’m saying what I can about the Grindelwald casting issue here,” she tweeted alongside a link to the post. “Based on our understanding of the circumstances, the film-makers and I are not only comfortable sticking with our original casting but genuinely happy to have Johnny playing a major character in the movies”.
